If the shaft is subjected to an axial force of 5 kN, determine the bearing stress acting on the collar A. <image 1>

A. 1.00 MPa
B. 1.11 MPa
C. 1.01 MPa
D. 1.10 MPa

To determine the bearing stress acting on the collar A, we need to consider the forces acting on the collar and the geometry of the assembly.

1. **Calculate the shear force at point A:**
   - The shear force at point A is the sum of the axial force and the moment about the axis of the collar.
   - The moment about the axis of the collar is given by:
     \[
     M = F \cdot d = 5 \, \text{kN} \cdot 100 \, \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{mm}^2 \cdot \text{kN} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text{N} \cdot \text{mm} = 5000 \, \text
